instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Hello, long time no post.

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board which has no power, USB provides approximately 5.2v on all ports and 0.05 / 0,06 amps.

We have got
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3v

Have not got
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>

I'm unfamiliar with exactly how this model works, aside from a few of louis' videos.

Looking at the board I saw corrosion under <TRANSISTOR>Q3440</TRANSISTOR> which was missing pin 3 on the chip side so will need to be replaced.  Is this enough to stop the laptop from booting?

The rest of the board looks OK. Is it worth reflowing the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> chip on that part of the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q3440</TRANSISTOR> is involved in the communication with the charger on that port.
All ports get 5V only?
Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q3440</TRANSISTOR> before trying other things on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q3440</TRANSISTOR> replaced. but all USB3 still draw 5v. 

Any ideas where I should look next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Update. Tested all ports again. 

One USBC port only draws 0.01A .

I'm not sure how to differentiate which port it's connected to at this stage. I'm running tests at varioius points, and will post below.

All draw 5.22v  v with no reset
J3300 side

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]Circuit[/TD]
[TD]Top (0.01a draw)[/TD]
[TD]Bottom (0.07 / 0.08a  draw)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_TOP_P</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]2.5v steady[/TD]
[TD]1.5v (varies)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]2.68v [/TD]
[TD]1.04v[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]

[TD]1.051[/TD]
[TD]1.6v (varies)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC2_CONN</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]0v[/TD]
[TD]1.6v (varies)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_BOT_N</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]1.55v[/TD]
[TD]2.588v[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_DBG_TOP_N</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]1.8v[/TD]
[TD]1.75v[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[TD]700mv (decaying)[/TD]
[TD]3.3v[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]1.5v (decaying slowly)[/TD]
[TD]12.27v[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

OK so....

One port does not provide main power rails to board which I discovered after testing outputs from USBC ROM chip.It didn't occur to be me to run seperate tests. 

I'm not quite following yet how one port can work through a circuit, but when connected with the other port, it does not work.
I have swapped the USBC connector, and the USB connector on the board looks OK.


Is this a <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> issue or a <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> isssue ?  I am having trouble separating out where the fault is.

Hope this information helps clear things up. I will post more after lunch!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Do you get 5V on all ports now?
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> gets voltage?
Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; be sure F7000 is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
5.21v on all ports. 
3 ports draw 0.7a 
1 port draws 0.1a

<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> is getting voltage (5.2v) ONLY when connected with ports drawing .7a, NOT with port drawing 0.1a

F7000  On"working" usb 12.29v on '0.1a" usb we get 1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
PPBUS G3H 0.332v diode mode to ground (assuming I did it right)

Issue appears to be localised to something going on with that one port.

I am assuming my issue is with <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> since that was the only area of damage I could see. 

Does that correlate with the port that is only drawing o.1a?

It's the port closest tothe back of the laptop / heat sync.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Yes, the problem is located on the "0.1A" port.
Use boardview to locate corresponding <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
You can also check which <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> doesn't generate 1V1 LDO.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Update

Reflowed area around suspected damaged <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>

Now all ports get 5.21v and 0.07a / 0.08a

All ports deliver power to F7000 (12.29v) and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> (5.2v)

Does not continue to 20v success :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Try DFU revive/restore now.
Be sure all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present.

threads.message:
Hello

Tried DFU.

Not sure how long I am supposed to wait. It appeared to work but laptop didn't boot like in video. Got to the point where it got "stuck"

I get this error, sometimes, when I try to run again. 

I didn't get this error when I attempted the second time (where the progress bar paused like in your video)

Laptop still drawing 5.2v 0.08a :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power - 5v
threads.message:
Try with Catalina and Big Sur too in the second machine, if you don't exactly know the macOS installed in T2 machine.

"<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> - 1.8 volts (pulsing / not stable)"
This could be a problem; should be stable, as all other SLPS2R voltages.
